title-group.article-title: Three new species and one new record of Tullbergiidae (Collembola: Onychiuroidea) from Tierra del Fuego

sec.p: Three new species and one new record of Tullbergiidae ( Collembola : Onychiuroidea) from Tierra del Fuego
JAVIER I. ARBEA
C/ Ría de Solía 3 , ch. 39, 39610 El Astillero ( Spain ). E-mail: jarbeapo@gmail.com

sec.title: Abstract
sec.p: Three new species, Tullbergia rapoporti sp. nov. , Dinaphorura nerudai sp. nov. and Dinaphorura najtae sp. nov. , and one new record, Tullbergia meridionalis Cassagnau & Rapoport, 1962 are described based on specimens from Tierra del Fuego. Tullbergia rapoporti sp. nov. is similar to T. crozetensis , but can be distinguished from it by the presence of an empodial appendage and the chaetotaxy of Abd VI. Dinaphorura nerudai sp. nov. is diagnosed by the dorsal pso formula, the seven spiniform processes on Abd VI, an elongate PAO, the absence of vesicle on Ant IV and the dorsal chaetotaxy. Dinaphorura najtae sp. nov. is characterised by the dorsal pso formula, the seven spiniform processes on Abd VI, a triangular PAO, the absence of vesicle on Ant IV and the dorsal chaetotaxy.

Key words : taxonomy, chaetotaxy, Tullbergia , Dinaphorura ,
southern South America

sec.title: Introduction
sec.p:
The family Tullbergiidae has a world-wide distribution and currently comprises thirty-two genera and 221 species (Bellinger et al.1996–2015 ). This family is represented in Tierra del Fuego by seven described species in only two genera: Tullbergia bisetosa Börner, 1903 , T. insularis Wahlgren, 1906 , T. quadrisetosa (Willem, 1902 )
, T. trisetosa (Schäffer, 1897 )
, Dinaphorura americana Rapoport, 1962 , D. magellanica Rubio, 1974 and D. spinosissima (Wahlgren, 1906 )
. In the present paper, one new species of Tullbergia and two new species of Dinaphorura are described. Specimens of Tullbergia meridionalis Cassagnau & Rapoport, 1962 are also described, which are recorded for the first time in the Tierra del Fuego region. These species were found among an abundant material of Collembola collected in the steppes of Tierra del Fuego, Argentina .

sec.title: Materials and methods
sec.p: Specimens were mounted in Hoyer’s medium, after clearing in Nesbitt’s solution. Material is deposited in the Argentinean Museum of Natural Sciences Bernardino Rivadavia at Buenos Aires, Argentina , in the National Museum of Natural Sciences at Madrid, Spain , and in the private collection of the author.

Abbreviations used: Abd—abdominal segments, AIIIO—sensorial organ of Ant III, Ant—antennal subsegments, PAO— postantennal sense organ, pso— pseudocelli, psp— pseudopores, Th—thoracic segments. MACN—Argentinean Museum of Natural Sciences Bernardino Rivadavia at Buenos Aires, Argentina , MNCN— National Museum of Natural Sciences at Madrid, Spain , JIAP—private collection of the author.

Etymology. I dedicate the new species to Professor Eduardo Hugo Rapoport, the eminent Argentinean ecologist and former taxonomist in Collembola .

body.p:
Discussion. The new species is related to Antarctic species of Tullbergia with 1,2, 2 pso on Th I–III, T. crozetensis Deharveng, 1981 , T. antarctica Lubbock, 1876 and T. maxima Deharveng, 1981 . Main differences between these species are summarised in
Table 4 . The new species is most similar to T. crozetensis . They differ in the empodial appendage (absent in T. crozetensis and 0.25–0.50 the length of claw in T. rapoporti sp. nov. ), the anal spine:claw III ratio ( 1.35 inT. crozetensis and 1.5–1.7 in the new species), the a0 chaeta on Abd VI:anal spine ratio ( 1.1 inT. crozetensis and 2 in the new species) and the m0 chaeta on Abd VI:anal spine ratio ( 0.8 inT. crozetensis and 1.65 in the new species).

Ventral chaetotaxy as in
. Head with 3 + 3 postlabial chaetae. Th I–III sterna with 0,1+1, 1+ 1 chaetae respectively. Ventral tube with 4 + 4 distal and 2 + 2 basal chaetae. Abd V sternum with 1 + 1 slightly thickened chaeta s lateral to genital plate.

Tibiotarsi with 15 ( 7 + 8 ), 15 ( 7 + 8 ), 14 ( 7 + 7 ) chaetae respectively (A 1 to 7 , B 1 to 7 and M present, B 7 absent on metatibiotarsus). Pretarsus with two chaetae each. Claw untoothed. Empodial appendage 0.2–0.23 the length of claw on leg III (
).

Remarks. Specimens from Tierra del Fuego conform to the original description by Cassagnau & Rapoport ( 1962 ) from Patagonia ( Argentina ) and differ to the description by Barra ( 1995 ) from Natal , South Africa : number of vesicles in PAO: 20–22 in the specimens from Natal , 36–52 in the specimens from Tierra del Fuego, 30–50 in the types from Patagonia; tibiotarsus III with 14 chaetae in the specimens from Tierra del Fuego, 12 chaetae in the specimens from Natal ; shape of PAO identical in specimens from Tierra del Fuego and Patagonia, different in the specimens from Natal ; position of pso on Abd IV egal in the specimens from Tierra del Fuego and Patagonia,, different in the specimens from Natal ; Ant. IV with sensilla S 7 and S 9 on the same level in the specimens from Tierra del Fuego and Patagonia, on the different level in the specimens from Natal ; shape of guard papillae in AIIIO the same in the specimens from Tierra del Fuego and Patagonia, different in the specimens from Natal . Specimens from Natal are almost certainly a different species, closely related to T. meridionalis . The geographical distribution of these species corroborates the idea that southern South America shares a common history with the other austral areas, reflecting the existence of an ancient austral biota (Rapoport 1971 ).

Type material. Holotype female, Tierra de Fuego, near Rio Grande, Argentina , Chiliotrichum dense scrub, with Festuca gracillima and Chiliotrichum diffusum (after Collantes et al.1999 ), S.M. Bonaventura and V. Mascitti leg.,
February 2001 . Paratypes : All specimens from same locality as holotype , 44 females
, 23 males
and 46 juveniles
. Holotype and 10paratypes deposited in MACN, 10paratypes in MNCN, and 93paratypes in JIAP.

Description. Body shape elongate. Length 1.25 mm (female holotype ), 1.1–1.4 mm (female paratypes ), 0.9 – 1.0 mm (male paratypes ). Colour white. Cuticular granulation of whole body relatively uniform but larger on posterior dorsum of Abd VI. Ungranulated cuticular ridges on dorsolateral anterior margins of Th III to Abd IV. Dorsal chaetae well differentiated into micro- and macrochaetae (
).

Dorsal chaetotaxy as in
. Th pleurites I, II, III with 2, 3, 3 chaetae respectively. Chaetae s on Th and Abd slightly thickened, similar in form to ordinary chaetae. Th II and III with basally thickened chaeta s in position m 7 and microsensillum ms adjacent to it. Abd I–IV with chaeta s in position p 3 . One chaeta s also present on Abd II– III as a 7 , on Abd IV–V as p 5 and a pair lateral to genital opening. Full description of dorsal chaetotaxy is given in
Table 6 . Abd VI with two large, curved anal spines placed on low papillae. Ratio anal spine:claw III as 1–1.25 : 1 . Seven spiniform processes on Abd VI, located as follows: 1 + 1 dorso-medial (dm), 2 + 2 latero-dorsal (ld) and 1 unpaired medio-ventral (mv) (
).

. Head with 3 + 3 postlabial chaetae. Th I–III sterna with 0,1+1, 1+ 1 chaetae respectively. Ventral tube with 4 + 4 distal and 2 + 2 basal chaetae. Abd V sternum with 1 + 1 slightly thickened chaeta s lateral to genital plate. Chaetotaxy of anal lobes as in

Legs chaetotaxy from I to III, coxae, 3,4+7,4+ 7 ; trochanters 6,6–7,6– 7 ; femora, 11,11,11; tibiotarsi with 15 ( 7 + 8 ), 15 ( 7 + 8 ), 14 ( 7 + 7 ) chaetae respectively (A 1 to 7 , B 1 to 7 and M present, B 7 absent on metatibiotarsus). Pretarsus with two chaetae each. Claw untoothed. Empodial appendage 0.15–0.25 the length of claw (
).
Etymology. The new species is dedicated to the late Chilean poet Pablo Neruda for his 111 birthday ( July 12, 1904 ).

Discussion. The new species belongs to the group of species with pso formula 11 /011/ 11111 , Abd VI with 7 spiniform processes and elongate PAO, D. chazeaui Weiner & Najt, 1991 , D. harrisoni Bagnall, 1948 , D. laterospina Salmon, 1941 , D. matileorum Najt, 1988 , D. pefauri Rubio & Najt, 1979 and D. spinosissima (Wahlgren, 1906 )
(Table 8 ). They differ in the number of vesicles on PAO (more than 26 vesicles in D. laterospina and D. pefauri ), the apical vesicle on Ant IV (present and conspicuous in D. laterospina , D. pefauri , D. harrisoni and D. spinosissima ) and the dorsal chaetotaxy (Table 8 ).

Type material. Holotype female, Tierra de Fuego, near Rio Grande, Argentina , Chiliotrichum dense scrub, with Festuca gracillima and Chiliotrichum diffusum (after Collantes et al . 1999 ), S.M. Bonaventura and V. Mascitti leg.,
February 2001 . Paratypes : All specimens from same locality as holotype , 41 females
, 7 males
and 6 juveniles
. Holotype and 10paratypes deposited in MACN, 10paratypes in MNCN, and 34paratypes in JIAP.

Description. Body shape elongate. Length 0.7 mm (female holotype ), 0.6–0.9 mm (female paratypes ), 0.6–0.7 mm (male paratypes ). Colour white. Cuticular granulation of whole body relatively uniform but larger on posterior dorsum of Abd VI. Ungranulated cuticular ridges on dorsolateral anterior margins of Th III to Abd IV. Dorsal chaetae well differentiated into micro- and macrochaetae (
).

Th II and III with basally thickened chaeta s in position m 7 and microsensillum ms adjacent to it. Abd I–IV with chaeta s in position p 3 . Etymology. The new species is dedicated to the late Judith Najt, a prominent Argentinean researcher of collembolan fauna, who passed away in 2014 .

Discussion. The new species is most similar to D. americana Rapoport, 1962 and D. jarai Najt & Rubio, 1978 , they share the pso formula 11 /011/ 11111 and triangular PAO (Table 8 ), but they differ in the number of vesicles on PAO ( 12–15 inD. americana , 10-11 inD. jarai vs 18–20 in the new species), the number of spiniform processes on Abd VI ( 5 inD. jarai vs 7 inD. americana and D. najtae sp. nov. ), the apical vesicle on Ant IV (present in D. jarai and D. americana vs
absent in the new species) and the dorsal chaetotaxy (Table 8 ).

Pso circular, stellate ( type I after Weiner & Najt 1991 ). Pso formula: 11 / 111 / 11121 (

Dorsal chaetotaxy as in

Ventral chaetotaxy as in
. Head with 3 + 3 postlabial chaetae. Th I–III sterna with 0,1+1, 1+ 1 chaetae respectively. Ventral tube with 4 + 4 distal and 2 + 2 basal chaetae. Abd V sternum with 1 + 1 slightly thickened chaeta s lateral to genital plate.

Tibiotarsi with 15 ( 7 + 8 ), 15 ( 7 + 8 ), 14 ( 7 + 7 ) chaetae respectively (A 1 to 7 , B 1 to 7 and M present, B 7 absent on metatibiotarsus). Pretarsus with two chaetae each. Claw untoothed. Empodial appendage 0.2–0.23 the length of claw on leg III (
).

Remarks. Specimens from Tierra del Fuego conform to the original description by Cassagnau & Rapoport ( 1962 ) from Patagonia ( Argentina ) and differ to the description by Barra ( 1995 ) from Natal , South Africa : number of vesicles in PAO: 20–22 in the specimens from Natal , 36–52 in the specimens from Tierra del Fuego, 30–50 in the types from Patagonia; tibiotarsus III with 14 chaetae in the specimens from Tierra del Fuego, 12 chaetae in the specimens from Natal ; shape of PAO identical in specimens from Tierra del Fuego and Patagonia, different in the specimens from Natal ; position of pso on Abd IV egal in the specimens from Tierra del Fuego and Patagonia,, different in the specimens from Natal ; Ant. IV with sensilla S 7 and S 9 on the same level in the specimens from Tierra del Fuego and Patagonia, on the different level in the specimens from Natal ; shape of guard papillae in AIIIO the same in the specimens from Tierra del Fuego and Patagonia, different in the specimens from Natal . Specimens from Natal are almost certainly a different species, closely related to T. meridionalis . The geographical distribution of these species corroborates the idea that southern South America shares a common history with the other austral areas, reflecting the existence of an ancient austral biota (Rapoport 1971 ).

Type material. Holotype female, Tierra de Fuego, near Rio Grande, Argentina , Chiliotrichum dense scrub, with Festuca gracillima and Chiliotrichum diffusum (after Collantes et al.1999 ), S.M. Bonaventura and V. Mascitti leg.,
February 2001 . Paratypes : All specimens from same locality as holotype , 44 females
, 23 males
and 46 juveniles
. Holotype and 10paratypes deposited in MACN, 10paratypes in MNCN, and 93paratypes in JIAP.

Description. Body shape elongate. Length 1.25 mm (female holotype ), 1.1–1.4 mm (female paratypes ), 0.9 – 1.0 mm (male paratypes ). Colour white. Cuticular granulation of whole body relatively uniform but larger on posterior dorsum of Abd VI. Ungranulated cuticular ridges on dorsolateral anterior margins of Th III to Abd IV. Dorsal chaetae well differentiated into micro- and macrochaetae (
).

Dorsal chaetotaxy as in
. Th pleurites I, II, III with 2, 3, 3 chaetae respectively. Chaetae s on Th and Abd slightly thickened, similar in form to ordinary chaetae. Th II and III with basally thickened chaeta s in position m 7 and microsensillum ms adjacent to it. Abd I–IV with chaeta s in position p 3 . One chaeta s also present on Abd II– III as a 7 , on Abd IV–V as p 5 and a pair lateral to genital opening. Full description of dorsal chaetotaxy is given in
Table 6 . Abd VI with two large, curved anal spines placed on low papillae. Ratio anal spine:claw III as 1–1.25 : 1 . Seven spiniform processes on Abd VI, located as follows: 1 + 1 dorso-medial (dm), 2 + 2 latero-dorsal (ld) and 1 unpaired medio-ventral (mv) (
).

Etymology. The new species is dedicated to the late Chilean poet Pablo Neruda for his 111 birthday ( July 12, 1904 ).

Discussion. The new species belongs to the group of species with pso formula 11 /011/ 11111 , Abd VI with 7 spiniform processes and elongate PAO, D. chazeaui Weiner & Najt, 1991 , D. harrisoni Bagnall, 1948 , D. laterospina Salmon, 1941 , D. matileorum Najt, 1988 , D. pefauri Rubio & Najt, 1979 and D. spinosissima (Wahlgren, 1906 )
(Table 8 ). They differ in the number of vesicles on PAO (more than 26 vesicles in D. laterospina and D. pefauri ), the apical vesicle on Ant IV (present and conspicuous in D. laterospina , D. pefauri , D. harrisoni and D. spinosissima ) and the dorsal chaetotaxy (Table 8 ).

Type material. Holotype female, Tierra de Fuego, near Rio Grande, Argentina , Chiliotrichum dense scrub, with Festuca gracillima and Chiliotrichum diffusum (after Collantes et al . 1999 ), S.M. Bonaventura and V. Mascitti leg.,
February 2001 . Paratypes : All specimens from same locality as holotype , 41 females
, 7 males
and 6 juveniles
. Holotype and 10paratypes deposited in MACN, 10paratypes in MNCN, and 34paratypes in JIAP.

Description. Body shape elongate. Length 0.7 mm (female holotype ), 0.6–0.9 mm (female paratypes ), 0.6–0.7 mm (male paratypes ). Colour white. Cuticular granulation of whole body relatively uniform but larger on posterior dorsum of Abd VI. Ungranulated cuticular ridges on dorsolateral anterior margins of Th III to Abd IV. Dorsal chaetae well differentiated into micro- and macrochaetae (
).

Tibiotarsi with 15 ( 7 + 8 ), 15 ( 7 + 8 ), 14 ( 7 + 7 ) chaetae respectively (A 1 to 7 , B 1 to 7 and M present, B 7 absent on metatibiotarsus). Pretarsus with two chaetae each. Claw untoothed. Empodial appendage 0.2–0.23 the length of claw on leg III (
).

Remarks. Specimens from Tierra del Fuego conform to the original description by Cassagnau & Rapoport ( 1962 ) from Patagonia ( Argentina ) and differ to the description by Barra ( 1995 ) from Natal , South Africa : number of vesicles in PAO: 20–22 in the specimens from Natal , 36–52 in the specimens from Tierra del Fuego, 30–50 in the types from Patagonia; tibiotarsus III with 14 chaetae in the specimens from Tierra del Fuego, 12 chaetae in the specimens from Natal ; shape of PAO identical in specimens from Tierra del Fuego and Patagonia, different in the specimens from Natal ; position of pso on Abd IV egal in the specimens from Tierra del Fuego and Patagonia,, different in the specimens from Natal ; Ant. IV with sensilla S 7 and S 9 on the same level in the specimens from Tierra del Fuego and Patagonia, on the different level in the specimens from Natal ; shape of guard papillae in AIIIO the same in the specimens from Tierra del Fuego and Patagonia, different in the specimens from Natal . Specimens from Natal are almost certainly a different species, closely related to T. meridionalis . The geographical distribution of these species corroborates the idea that southern South America shares a common history with the other austral areas, reflecting the existence of an ancient austral biota (Rapoport 1971 ).

Discussion. The new species belongs to the group of species with pso formula 11 /011/ 11111 , Abd VI with 7 spiniform processes and elongate PAO, D. chazeaui Weiner & Najt, 1991 , D. harrisoni Bagnall, 1948 , D. laterospina Salmon, 1941 , D. matileorum Najt, 1988 , D. pefauri Rubio & Najt, 1979 and D. spinosissima (Wahlgren, 1906 )

).

Table 7 . Abd VI with two large, curved anal spines placed on low papillae. Ratio anal spine:claw III as 1–1.17 : 1 . Seven spiniform processes on Abd VI, located as follows: 1 + 1 dorso-medial (dm), 2 + 2 latero-dorsal (ld) and 1 unpaired medio-ventral (mv) (
).

Ventral chaetotaxy as in
. Head with 3 + 3 postlabial chaetae. Th I–III sterna with 0,1+1, 1+ 1 chaetae respectively. Ventral tube with 4 + 4 distal and 2 + 2 basal chaetae. Abd V sternum with 1 + 1 slightly thickened chaeta s lateral to genital plate. Chaetotaxy of anal lobes as in

Legs chaetotaxy from I to III, coxae, 3,4+7,4+ 7 ; trochanters 6,6,6; femora, 11,11,11; tibiotarsi with 15 ( 7 + 8 ), 15 ( 7 + 8 ), 14 ( 7 + 7 ) chaetae respectively (A 1 to 7 , B 1 to 7 and M present, B 7 absent on metatibiotarsus). Pretarsus with two chaetae each. Claw untoothed. Empodial appendage 0.23–0.28 the length of claw (
).
Etymology. The new species is dedicated to the late Judith Najt, a prominent Argentinean researcher of collembolan fauna, who passed away in 2014 .

Discussion. The new species is most similar to D. americana Rapoport, 1962 and D. jarai Najt & Rubio, 1978 , they share the pso formula 11 /011/ 11111 and triangular PAO (Table 8 ), but they differ in the number of vesicles on PAO ( 12–15 inD. americana , 10-11 inD. jarai vs 18–20 in the new species), the number of spiniform processes on Abd VI ( 5 inD. jarai vs 7 inD. americana and D. najtae sp. nov. ), the apical vesicle on Ant IV (present in D. jarai and D. americana vs
absent in the new species) and the dorsal chaetotaxy (Table 8 ).

mixed-citation.named-content: Three new species and one new record of Tullbergiidae (Collembola: Onychiuroidea) from Tierra del Fuego

).

).

represents the sensorial apparatus of Ant III–IV, dorsal chaetotaxy, arrangement of pso and morphology of PAO in first instar larvae.

The new species belongs to the group of species with pso formula 11 /011/ 11111 , Abd VI with 7 spiniform processes and elongate PAO, D. chazeaui Weiner & Najt, 1991 , D. harrisoni Bagnall, 1948 , D. laterospina Salmon, 1941 , D. matileorum Najt, 1988 , D. pefauri Rubio & Najt, 1979 and D. spinosissima (Wahlgren, 1906 )
(Table 8 ). They differ in the number of vesicles on PAO (more than 26 vesicles in D. laterospina and D. pefauri ), the apical vesicle on Ant IV (present and conspicuous in D. laterospina , D. pefauri , D. harrisoni and D. spinosissima ) and the dorsal chaetotaxy (Table 8 ).

Type material. Holotype female, Tierra de Fuego, near Rio Grande, Argentina , Chiliotrichum dense scrub, with Festuca gracillima and Chiliotrichum diffusum (after Collantes et al . 1999 ), S.M. Bonaventura and V. Mascitti leg.,
February 2001 . Paratypes : All specimens from same locality as holotype , 41 females
, 7 males
and 6 juveniles
. Holotype and 10paratypes deposited in MACN, 10paratypes in MNCN, and 34paratypes in JIAP.

Description. Body shape elongate. Length 0.7 mm (female holotype ), 0.6–0.9 mm (female paratypes ), 0.6–0.7 mm (male paratypes ). Colour white. Cuticular granulation of whole body relatively uniform but larger on posterior dorsum of Abd VI. Ungranulated cuticular ridges on dorsolateral anterior margins of Th III to Abd IV. Dorsal chaetae well differentiated into micro- and macrochaetae (
).

(*) Abd vI with 2 large curved anal hοrns οn papillae and nine shοrt fat spines after οriginal descriptiοn, but οnly 7 spinifοrm prοcesses are shοwn in the οriginal drawing (Fig. 134 ).

Dorsal chaetotaxy as in
. Th pleurites I, II, III with 2, 3, 3 chaetae respectively. Chaetae s on Th and Abd slightly thickened, similar in form to ordinary chaetae. Th II and III with basally thickened chaeta s in position m 7 and microsensillum ms adjacent to it. Abd I–IV with chaeta s in position p 3 . One chaeta s also present on Abd II– III as a 7 , on Abd IV–V as p 5 and a pair lateral to genital opening. Full description of dorsal chaetotaxy is given in
Table 7 . Abd VI with two large, curved anal spines placed on low papillae. Ratio anal spine:claw III as 1–1.17 : 1 . Seven spiniform processes on Abd VI, located as follows: 1 + 1 dorso-medial (dm), 2 + 2 latero-dorsal (ld) and 1 unpaired medio-ventral (mv) (
).

Ventral chaetotaxy as in
. Head with 3 + 3 postlabial chaetae. Th I–III sterna with 0,1+1, 1+ 1 chaetae respectively. Ventral tube with 4 + 4 distal and 2 + 2 basal chaetae. Abd V sternum with 1 + 1 slightly thickened chaeta s lateral to genital plate. Chaetotaxy of anal lobes as in
.

Legs chaetotaxy from I to III, coxae, 3,4+7,4+ 7 ; trochanters 6,6,6; femora, 11,11,11; tibiotarsi with 15 ( 7 + 8 ), 15 ( 7 + 8 ), 14 ( 7 + 7 ) chaetae respectively (A 1 to 7 , B 1 to 7 and M present, B 7 absent on metatibiotarsus). Pretarsus with two chaetae each. Claw untoothed. Empodial appendage 0.23–0.28 the length of claw (
).
Etymology. The new species is dedicated to the late Judith Najt, a prominent Argentinean researcher of collembolan fauna, who passed away in 2014 .

Discussion. The new species is most similar to D. americana Rapoport, 1962 and D. jarai Najt & Rubio, 1978 , they share the pso formula 11 /011/ 11111 and triangular PAO (Table 8 ), but they differ in the number of vesicles on PAO ( 12–15 inD. americana , 10-11 inD. jarai vs 18–20 in the new species), the number of spiniform processes on Abd VI ( 5 inD. jarai vs 7 inD. americana and D. najtae sp. nov. ), the apical vesicle on Ant IV (present in D. jarai and D. americana vs
absent in the new species) and the dorsal chaetotaxy (Table 8 ).
1 Abd VI with 2 anal spines and without spiniform processes ( Tullbergia ).......................................... 2
- Abd VI with 2 anal spines and 5 or 7 spiniform processes ( Dinaphorura )........................................ 8
3 Pso formula 11 / 111 / 11111 ............................ T. insularis Wahlgren, 1906 (Tierra del Fuego and Falkland Is.)

4 PAO with 20–22 vesicles........... T. meridionalis Cassagnau & Rapoport, 1962sensu Barra ( 1995 )
( Natal , South Africa )

5 PAO with 30–52 vesicles........................................... T. meridionalis Cassagnau & Rapoport, 1962 ( bisetosa form after Cassagnau & Rapoport, 1962 : Patagonian Argentina and Chile , Tierra del Fuego)

- PAO with 55–80 vesicles............................................................. T. bisetosa Börner, 1903 (Kerguelen Is., Marion Is., Macquarie Is., Heard I., South Georgia Is., Falkland I, Tierra del Fuego and Magallanes, Chile )
- Th pso formula 122 .............................................. Tullbergia rapoporti sp. nov. (Tierra del Fuego)

7 Abd IV with 1 + 1 pso............................................ T. quadrisetosa (Willem, 1902 )
(Tierra del Fuego)

- Abd IV with 2 + 2 pso................ T. trisetosa (Schäffer, 1897 )
p.p. (Tierra del Fuego, Patagonia and Magallanes, Chile )
8 Abd VI with five spiniform processes........................................ D. magellanica Rubio, 1974 ( Chile )
10 PAO with 12–15 vesicles. Apical vesicle of Ant IV simple.............. D. americana Rapoport, 1962 ( Argentina , Chile )
- PAO with 18–20 vesicles. Apical vesicle of Ant IV absent........................ D. najtae sp. nov. (Tierra del Fuego)

11 Apical vesicle of Ant IV trilobed. PAO with 22–24 vesicles................ D. spinosissima (Wahlgren, 1906 )
( Argentina )
- Apical vesicle of Ant IV absent. PAO with 18–20 vesicles....................... D. nerudai sp. nov. (Tierra del Fuego)
